x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Many young adults and low-income families struggle with budgeting, saving, and understanding financial basics. NGOs and educators try to teach financial literacy, but often rely on static materials, one-time workshops, or generic advice. There’s no interactive, community-driven platform to help people set micro-goals, track progress, and celebrate financial wins & especially in a way that’s sponsor-friendly and gamified
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: MoneyWise - Community Financial Literacy & Micro-Goal Tracker
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • Users can set personal financial goals and track progress (e.g., saving, budgeting, debt reduction)
  • NGOs and educators can assign challenges, host workshops, and monitor impact
  • QR codes link to goal trackers, workshop invites, and digital badges
  • Dashboards show community-wide progress, sponsor impact, and engagement metrics
  • Optional: Peer groups and leaderboards to encourage shared learning
  • Nudges and reminders help users stay on track with their goals

 

Capabilities:

  • App Engine Studio for goal records, user profiles, and educator dashboards
  • Flow Designer for reminders, badge generation, and progress updates
  • UI Builder for mobile-friendly dashboards and sponsor views
  • IntegrationHub for syncing with SMS/email platforms or financial APIs
  • Attachment API for uploading workshop materials or certificates
  • QR Code Generation & Base64 Encoding for goal access and badge sharing
  • Scoped App with ACLs for privacy, role-based access, and educator permissions

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Optional: SMS or WhatsApp gateway for nudges and reminders
  • QR code generation for goal tracking and badge access
  • Optional: Financial APIs or calculators for budgeting templates
  • Optional: Gamification engine for badges and challenge

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Designing a simple, inclusive UX for users with low digital literacy
  • Ensuring privacy and consent for financial data
  • Encouraging consistent engagement beyond initial workshops
  • Balancing gamification with real-world impact
  • Building trust and adoption among NGOs and educators
